top_comment.text:
The young people of the middle and higher classes of the USA,   when they 
are teenagers they indulge  in drinking, drugs, in that demented  music 
call Rock (filthy thing), and in raping.  Later in life they keep 
consumming drugs while becoming highly salaried Yuppies who pay enormous 
amounts of money to city drug traffickers, who later pay to Mex and 
Colombian cartels which receive an smaller but substantial cut of the 
money. The cartels receive also all the finger pointing and the 
self-righteous accusations.
-
But those fucking white yuppies who pay for the drug are the main guilty 
ones, they feed the market and feed the crime.   Or who is the worst 
sinner?  The ones who pay to fulfill his crave for sinning, or the ones who 
sin to get some payment ?﻿
top_comment.author: Powerdriller Power

comments.text:

studies for the last hundred years. Furthermore you don't take into effect 
that the population has nearly doubled since then. i am not saying it got 
overly better but the ratio hasn't increased either.
comments.author: Greg Stewart

comments.text:
+Greg Stewart
Thomas Sowell presented all the convincing evidence in his books, he is a 
Philosopher but his training was of Economist, and he worked keeping stats 
about everything, he then discovered that opinions like the ones you have 
been spiting in this thread are dead wrong.
comments.author: Powerdriller Power

comments.text:
and even more rape happened back then but it wasn't dealt with as swiftly 
as it is know so even if there was less statistically it was happening a 
lot more.Oh and tell me how my timelines are wrong, you didn't even say why 
you give no evidence.
comments.author: Greg Stewart

comments.text:
one guy saying so doesn't make it right, also the average age for even 
getting married back then was like 16 you are making no sense and you are 
babbling about multiple different topics without having a point.
comments.author: Greg Stewart

comments.text: show me one statistic by government, not a philosopher.
comments.author: Greg Stewart

comments.text:
Well, you are dead wrong about the history and statistics and the time line 
of  teen pregnancy, broken families and drug abuse.  Before the 1960s, 
those problems were much less problematic that in the 1970s, 1980s and 
later.
-
In particular for Blacks:  Crime, children born out of wedlock, 
unemployment, poverty in general, were factors that were slowly but 
 dwindling since the 1910s, 1920s up to the 1960s, when something happened 
and reversed the good tendency.
-
Read or search for references of  Thomas Sowell, who happens to be Black, 
and a great political analyst and philosopher, he have written many books, 
in particular one called "The Vision of the Anointed", published by 
BasicBooks 1995. He discredits with evidence all you false beliefs.
comments.author: Powerdriller Power

comments.text:
Buddy, all of those things existed more so back then they do now, teen 
pregnancy was a norm, there was no black family units they were to busy 
getting beat and being in segregated schools. The only difference between 
then and now is that, now you can watch it on CNN. Oh and by the way, I 
corrected all of your "points". And yes the politicians are corrupt as hell 
thats why out of the 4-6 ridiculous things you said i allowed that one to 
slide. Pick your battles. You know what i'm saying. Furthermore do you 
forget what this so called "debate" was about or do you believe that if you 
say one right thing out of all of the false and ill-informed things you 
state, suddenly this gives merit to the inaccurate bullshit that you have 
been spouting this entire time. You know what? Don't worry about what i am 
saying. A brain so hostile to outside points of view and reason is not 
worth wasting oxygen and time over. GIVE YOUR HEAD A SEVERE SHAKE. YOU ARE 
EXPERIENCING A GROTESQUE VOLUME  OF IGNORANCE. Even further, the drugs 
didn't bloom in the 60"s the enforcement against them did causing the 
violence and the so called "MEX" cartels to develop in the first place. and 
the "Mafia" as you call it was around since the WW1 it was given financial 
benefit with the prohibitions thus proving my point again you can outlaw 
anything you want. It is fixing "why" it occurs, that will yield a solution 
to the problem.
comments.author: Greg Stewart

comments.text:
+Greg Stewart
You did not reply about my conjecture that Banksters and Senators profit 
with the Drug Traffic. 

About your replies, well they show that you do not know what you are 
talking about. The drug traffic business bloomed in the 60s, exactly when 
the "liberation philosophy" and the "human rights" movement showed up. The 
Mex cartels did not still exist, but the new market attracted the attention 
of the USA Mafia which started to make deals with  Colombian producers, and 
the rest is history. 
-
And not only drug abuse exploded and reached the middle and upper classes 
youth, also other problems like teenage pregnancy, the decomposition of 
families chiefly the Black Families, Cities like  Detroit devolving into 
savagery,  crime among blacks that had been dwindling since the 1920s, 
suddenly skyrocketed in the 70s.
comments.author: Powerdriller Power

comments.text: Anything else ?
comments.author: Greg Stewart

comments.text:
On top of all this you missed my point, lol. YOU WILL NEVER GET RID OF 
DRUGS AS MUCH AS YOU WILL NEVER GET RID OF MURDER. The only way to halt it 
as much as possible is to educate and parent people (children) so they will 
not make the mistake in the first place. and I'm quite confident that the 
drug cartels are responsible for a much higher rate of murder than any kid 
trying to get "buzzed". lol man i lower my resolve to humanities problems 
when i realize such idiocy still exists.
comments.author: Greg Stewart

comments.text:
and the "60's" inspired a turn against racism so it couldn't have been all 
bad even with the drugs, as well as a reform to handicapped access 
abilities especially Vietnam vets so your points are mute. lol PLEASE DO 
SOME RESEARCH BEFORE ARGUING WITH PEOPLE. don't take my word, just look it 
up and not a biased site that you are currently acquiring your information 
from. lol people are silly.
comments.author: Greg Stewart

comments.text:
And i would love for you to give me a link on the statistic that all drug 
cartel members live 5 years or at least on average as you presume.
comments.author: Greg Stewart

comments.text:
You are jumping topic to topic without a real point. dude lol If you think 
a movie staring Leo is going to inspire someone to do drugs, you have a 
poor and weak parenting skill. and top of that the movie depicted a life of 
an asshole in a comedic way as such to be entertaining its not a biography, 
lol you are overly fragile and ignorant  individual that would rather point 
a finger than deal with the real issue. And on top of that, most religion 
glorifies murder in the "name of god" so essentially you are a kettle 
calling a pot black.
comments.author: Greg Stewart

comments.text:
+Greg Stewart
You are wrong, the main guilt falls on  the consumers. And who are the real 
providers anyway? Who benefits the most? The Mex traffickers who are hardly 
literate and have an average life expectancy of 5 years after they enter 
the business? Or maybe the immigration or DEA officers that allowed a quota 
to pass the border? Or the American Bankers that do the laundry? Or the 
politicians that receive a cut? 
 
A Government guilt is also for allowing  the Hollywood Movie Industry to 
present drug abuse as a "cool" thing that teenagers do as part of 
"maturing".
-
Hollywood even glorifies drugs usage as a part of a romantic reminiscence 
of the 1960s hippie culture. And the drug inducing  Rock Music is still the 
favorite of the American youth, the musicians have to be and look stoned to 
have impact and success. 
-
Also, Yuppies have to get stoned to resist working 16-18 hours a day, or 
they need to have time for orgy and debauching parties like the ones 
portrayed in the recent ssuccessful movie called "Wall Street" , played by 
Di Caprio, .
comments.author: Powerdriller Power

comments.text:
The ones who provide it are the worst, but that is irrelevant. if you want 
to treat the disease fully.You can do one of two things: you can treat the 
illness brought on by the environment surrounding it or you can treat the 
environment that causes it thus debilitating the disease before it starts. 
In other words the lack of education and government responsibility (minimal 
government funded rehabilitation and lack of adequate drug and alcohol 
courses in schooling) will cause people to be un aware of dangers 
associated with drugs and alcohol, especially if they are doing so in such 
a naive age as which you exclaim. you can not solve this with religion. NO 
OFFENCE.
comments.author: Greg Stewart
